frontmatter.title: Asynchronous in Javascript
frontmatter.author: James
frontmatter.excerpt: Javascript is a single-threaded, and all codes are executed in a sequence, not in a parallel fashion. In other words, unlike other languages such as Java, there is only one thread in Javascript, and it can be blocked by an expensive operation.
